template.name: Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2
template.description:
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.26

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Storage units
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size, in bytes, of the data objects allocated from this pool. If this entry is monitoring sectors, blocks, buffers, or packets, for example, this number will commonly be greater than one. Otherwise this number will typically be one.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Used storage in units
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Total space in units
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main storage allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual storage might be modified.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"} and (({Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.total[storageTotal.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.used[storageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<5G or {Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 5G. - The disk will be full in less than 24hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#SNMPVALUE}"} and (({Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.total[storageTotal.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.used[storageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<10G or {Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#SNMPVALUE}"})
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 10G. - The disk will be full in less than 24hours.

dependency.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"})
dependency.expression: {Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"} and (({Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.total[storageTotal.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.used[storageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<5G or {Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB storage SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

template.name: Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB memory SNMPv2
template.description:
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.26

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: Memory units
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size, in bytes, of the data objects allocated from this pool. If this entry is monitoring sectors, blocks, buffers, or packets, for example, this number will commonly be greater than one. Otherwise this number will typically be one.

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: Used memory in units
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: Total memory in units
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

template.name: Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB CPU SNMPv2
template.description:
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.26

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle. Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.

template.name: Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB SNMPv2
template.description:
HOST-RESOURCES-MIB: CPU, memory and storage
Template tooling version used: 0.26
